node.title: Labor announces 2030 emissions reductions target
node.alt: The silhouette of a smoking gas plant is contrasted against a golden sunset.
node.description: Federal Labor is committing to cutting greenhouse gas emissions by 43 per cent by 2030, if it wins government at the next election.
node.content: ["Federal Labor is committing to cutting greenhouse gas emissions by 43 per cent by 2030, if it wins government at the next election.", "It is slightly lower than the 45 per cent target the party\u00a0took to the last election, but higher than the Coalition's longstanding target of 26 to 28 per cent.", "The Coalition is projecting Australia's emissions will have fallen by as much as 35 per cent by 2030, but will not commit to reaching that.", "Both Labor and the government\u00a0have committed to reaching net zero emissions by 2050, but the government has been criticised for hanging its plan to get there on technologies that do not exist yet.", "In October, the government announced it would commit to the target after weeks of bitter debate within the Coalition which saw some Nationals MPs say they would never support the policy.", "The pace of cutting emissions and the level of support for industry to transition\u00a0are\u00a0set to be a key issues at\u00a0the federal election next year.", "More to come."]
